items.sentence: I thought maybe you\'d changed your mind about going to Boston.
I know a lot of French words, but I can\'t really speak French.
Tom used to eat out every day, but he can\'t afford to anymore.
We don\'t allow Tom to watch TV until he finishes his homework.
Tom and I were speaking in French when Mary came into the room.
I don\'t feel like working. How about going to a movie instead?
I don\'t have enough money to buy the medicine my father needs.
When I was thirteen years old, I couldn\'t speak French at all.
Don\'t come back until you\'ve done what I\'ve asked you to do.
Tom doesn\'t think he\'ll be able to finish the job by himself.
